NF.Q: In the column Farming of the sankey chart, which nodes have an outflow exceeded 4294? Please list the node labels and their corresponding outflow values.

NF.Q: Between which pairs of nodes in column Consumption and column Processing is the flow between 1383 and 1508? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {1391} from node {Food Waste} to {Cleaning}, a flow of {1414} from node {Food Waste} to {Grinding}, a flow of {1438} from node {Food Preparation} to {Freezing}.

NF.Q: In the sankey chart, which links have a flow between 1402 and 1626? Please list the source node, target node, and their corresponding flow values.

NC.Q: Between the flows from node Pest Control to node Retail Purchase and from node Retail Purchase to node Canning, which path has a larger flow?
NC.A: The flow from node {Pest Control} to node {Retail Purchase} is larger.

NC.Q: Between the flows from node Pest Control to node Food Waste and from node Pest Control to node Retail Purchase, which path has a larger flow?

NC.Q: Among the flows from node Food Waste to node Sorting, from node Retail Purchase to node Canning, and from node Food Waste to node Packaging, which path has the largest flow?
NC.A: The flow from node {Retail Purchase} to node {Canning} is the largest.

MSR.Q: Which node in the column Consumption of the sankey chart is the most critical?
MSR.A: The most critical node in the column Consumption is {Retail Purchase}.

MSR.Q: What is the path with the highest total flow from source node Pest Control to target node Canning? Please list all node labels along this path.
MSR.A: The path with the highest total flow from node Pest Control to node Canning is: {Pest Control, Retail Purchase, Canning}.
